summary:
An employee from Moody's Collision Repair in Scarborough contacted the ME Veterans Home stating they had an fabric mail carrier with Veterans patient information in it. ME Veterans Home contacted Employee A and he picked up the information. Upon review, he identified the information was for Home Based Primary Care patients (17 total). The carrier had been unlocked. The RN that lost the information was contacted and she stated she was not aware she was  missing the information and had contact with it the day before. She stated she must have lost the carrier when she was moving equipment from one car to another.
Employee A contacted the Privacy Officer (PO) and the facility has now identified that the only forms with Personally Identifiable Information (PII) was the Patient
Care Consent and authorization forms with Veterans' full names and full SSNs. No other PII was released. All of the information has been retrieved.

victim.victim_id: United States Department of Veterans Affairs
